sentence.Network_en: When it comes to music, I'm a complete ignoramus.
sentence.Network_cn: 说到音乐，我完全是个门外汉。

sentence.Network_en: This ignoramus failed to salute me.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个蠢汉看见我不行礼.

sentence.Network_en: How infuriating it would be if her husband turned out to be such a complete ignoramus!
sentence.Network_cn: 假使丈夫这样愚昧无知,岂不活活气死人!

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (as the endorsement made by a grand jury on an indictment considered backed by insufficient evidence to bring before a petty jury): Latin, literally we do not know' (in legal use 'we take no notice of it'), from ignorare (see ignore). The modern sense may derive from the name of a character in George Ruggle's Ignoramus (1615), a satirical comedy exposing lawyers' ignorance

entry.def: If you describe someone as an ignoramus, you are being critical of them because they do not have the knowledge you think they ought to have.

auth_sentence.content: Sorry but you are still an anti-science ignoramus.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sorry but you are still an anti-science ignoramus.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sorry but you are still an anti-science ignoramus.

auth_sentence.content: 'T take this personally but you are either a liar or an ignoramus.
auth_sentence.res_content: 'T take this personally but you are either a liar or an ignoramus.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: 'T take this personally but you are either a liar or an ignoramus.

auth_sentence.content: You cannot govern, you cannot administrate, with an ignoramus.
